values:
Recently I received a $1 bill with this stamped on the back:

"See where I've been! Track where I will go next! Enter my serial number at www.WheresGeorge.com I thought this might be a fun project for grandson MiniBob and myself - maybe get him interested in something other than video games on the computer.  We went to the site and entered the serial number and saw that the tracking of this particular bill started in Amarillo, TX, maybe a couple other appearances there, and now we've logged our entry for Dallas.  I gave the bill to MiniBob to spend and we'll watch and see if anyone else tracks an entry for it. We also wrote "Track me at wheresGeorge.com" on 5 $1 bills and will redistribute them in the next few days.  If any of you Dallas-area readers should happen to get one (not likely I know), be sure and log it for us.
I finally decided on a a digital camera.   This one came highly recommended.  Now to figure out how to use it effectively...
Weird dreams last night.  One I remember is beating the sh*t out of that creepy, old guy from the Six Flags commercials.  How screwed up is that??

You guys be careful out there tonight - CopSon and his associates call this Amateur Night.  Angela, the pugsters and I are staying locked inside the house tonight.  Our tradition is to consume large quantities of fried shrimp.  I have no idea how this got started, but we've been doing it for close to 30 years now.  Tomorrow we will watch the Rose Parade as we take down all the Christmas decorations.  

Happy 2005 to all!

I never did get the red paint out of my beard.  I took a rag soaked in paint remover and rubbed it on a little section.  It took the paint off, but it left the hair a weird texture and a bit discolored.  Yes, I could trim it.  It's only 2 inches or so and no one would even notice it had been cut.  It's the principle, so I will just leave it be.  It will wear off on its own eventually.  Or maybe,  I should dip the whole lower half into the paint, that way it won't look like it was an accident.  :-)

It is snowing like crazy here. I mean, nothing like my buddy Lew is used to seeing.  Here everyone completely freaks once the first flake hits the ground, but after all we had temps in the low 70's last week. Tomorrow morning we are supposed to leave for the evil in-laws' house for Christmas.  I would not be TOO disappointed if that did not happen. The Pug Brothers are refusing to go outside.  They don't like snow. I guess I will have to go out with them...
Anyone have any ideas on how to get red paint out of a gray beard?

From

(HP = Harry Potter, or so I'm told)

How about a little text message fun today? Your assignment: tell me your favorite names for having sex. For example: "doing the horizontal bop". I'll publish the best ones in a later journal entry.



TEXT ME!!

Google has released a new feature that allows you to get phone numbers, product prices and other info on your cellphone via text message.  Very cool.

Google SMS

I'm not sure which pissed me off more:  the asshole in the black Cutlass who is too stupid to operate a turn signal, or the dried-up bag of shit in the black Lexus who kept her right turn signal on for at least 2 miles.  Where are Cop-Son and co. when you need them?

Weird news item of the day: Man Mistakenly Cuts Off Penis, Dog Eats It Mon Oct 4,10:41 AM ET Oddly Enough - Reuters BUCHAREST (Reuters) - A elderly Romanian man mistook his penis for a chicken's neck, cut it off and his dog rushed up and ate it, the state Rompres news agency said Monday. It said 67 year-old Constantin Mocanu, from a village near the southeastern town of Galati, rushed out into his yard in his underwear to kill a noisy chicken keeping him awake at night. "I confused it with the chicken's neck," Mocanu, who was admitted to the emergency hospital in Galati, was quoted as saying. "I cut it ... and the dog rushed and ate it." Doctors said the man, who was brought in by an ambulance bleeding heavily, was now out of danger.
SuperTarget already has their Christmas section up.  Bleh.
Looks like the LJ email delivery thing is down again?  If I owe you a response, I'll get to it eventually.

Wow, it has been a long time since I posted.  I've been in one of those sit-back-and-watch moods for awhile, but I do read all my Friends' journals every day or so.

Tonight, after 9 months without trimming my mustache, I took about 4 inches off my mustache. You can actually see my mouth now.  :)  Don't worry, I didn't (and won't) trim the beard any.

This week I've been filling in at one of the local tattoo studios. It feels great to be doing that again, and my hand has not hurt at all.  Kind of makes me want to do it again...  Hhmmm..   If I could only find a shop where I could come and go as I pleased, but did not have the extra burden of being the owner/boss.

Well, that's kind of creepy isn't it?
Does anyone else find the old guy who dances and spins around in the Six Flags commercials to be more than a little creepy?  I change the channel when those commercials are on.

Yesterday I downloaded and installed the Mozilla Firefox browser.  I have to say I do like it and will continue to use it.  And yet, I'm disappointed.  Because of all the hype, I really expected it to be revolutionary - the same way iTunes and Gmail have changed the way I look at music players and email programs.  Some of the features are cool, but most of them, including the tabbed interface, are available for IE through 3rd party tools.  However, in the past couple weeks, I've had random lockups in IE, requiring the application to be ended, so Firefox is the new browser for now.

In other news, Dave the St Bernard is staying with us this week while his people are on vacation.  I will try to get some pictures of him playing with the Pug Brothers.  I swear that dog thinks he is the same size as a pug.  I just hope he does not fall down and squish one of my little guys.

The good thing about being awake at 4:20am is that LiveJournal is actually SPEEDY.

Still ONE Gmail invite left.  Don't miss out!  If you are interested, send email to my LJ address and include your first and last name.  

First come, first served.  I'll put you on the waiting list if their are multiple requests.
Updated 6:09 am 06/24 I have six four three ONE Gmail invites if anybody would like one. Send email to my LJ address and include your first and last name.

For those of you who use the ZoneAlarm firewall software (either the free version or the PRO version), DO NOT INSTALL version 5 if you have an HP inkjet printer.  This combination causes major printing headaches for many, but not all, models of HP printers.  The message boards on the ZoneAlarms website is full of letters from angry people having this problem.
Well, I did not win last night's $100 million Lotto Texas drawing.  But then again, no one else won either.  Wednesday's drawing is for $120 million.

Angela, Cop Son and I celebrated Mini-Bob's birthday yesterday by taking him to Six Flags for the day. We had a great time, but this 54 year old body is not use to being slung around, spun upside down and slammed into things. I am SORE today. Shit, even my beard is sore.
Can someone explain the appeal of that CarrotTop person?  I just don't get it.

Took a long ride on the Harley this morning.  The first real ride in a couple weeks.  I do my best thinking while on the bike, and I've had a lot on my mind lately.  Took a quick lap around the lake - the crape myrtles are beginning to bloom - and then headed for open highway.  I ended up in a little Mom&Pop diner place in Canton.  The owners were nice enough folks, though they seemed a little scared of me since no one else was in the cafe (I get that a lot).  They made me a good burger w/swiss, fries and a choc. milkshake.  I ate quickly, wished them well and left since it was beginning to look like rain was headed this way.

The trip back was uneventful.  No rain yet.  It was hot and very humid and I was sweating buckets, but even that seemed somehow refreshing.  Does that make sense?

So, I am back now - the pug brothers snuggled at my feet.  Angela is out spending money somewhere.  I hear the hammock calling my name...

Fantasia...bleh.  the singer, not the movie.
Happiness is...discovering a forgotten box of Girl Scout cookies (Thin Mints!) in the back of the freezer.

Dear LiveJournal,

You suck (again).  Why why why can't you just leave things alone?
I had someone drop me from their Friends list because "I didn't post enough."  The logic of this escapes me.

Thanks for all the text messages. Keep them coming. Some of ya'll are seriously disturbed. I love it!!

My phone is usually nearby so feel free to send me a message any time.

This is apparently from some website http://word-of-mouth-connection.com .   I've received 3 of these in the last few weeks.  Very interesting.  Is anyone in LJ Land familiar with this service??
LiveJournal finally wised up and added support for RichText mode.  Thank you.  Now my 53 year old brain doesn't have to remember those stupid HTML commands.
, howdy!  And welcome to my journal.
Friends are the Bacon Bits in the Salad Bowl of Life.

Fun day today.  I rode in a Toy Run for Toys for Tots.  Bikers rode from Dallas and Ft. Worth and met up in Arlington to deliver the toys.  We had beautiful weather and a tremendous turnout.  The news station are reporting 30,000 bikers took part.

This evening was spent wrapping Christmas gifts.  Bleh.  Angela refuses to help - "you bought the stuff, so you wrap it."  Thanks, hon.  

You would think that since I spent decades in a profession requiring great hand dexterity, that I would be good at something as simple as wrapping a present.  Not so.  As soon as I pick up the roll of paper, my fingers become huge and uncooperative. The result looks only slightly better than those items wrapped by my 5-year old grandson. 

Lucky for me the Pug Brothers don't give a damn if their presents are nicely wrapped or not.  :)
I am ready to change cellphone companies. SprintPCS has dropped one too many calls.  Recommendations anyone (especially you Dallas-area folks)??
